greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: number of connected graphs with k >= 0 edges and n nodes (1<=n<=k+1).
comment: The diagonal n = k+1 is A000055(n). - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Aug 10 2008
reference: F. Harary and E. M. Palmer, Graphical Enumeration, Academic Press, NY, 1973, p. 93, Table 4.2.2; p. 241, Table A2.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
G. A. Baker et al., High-temperature expansions for the spin-1/2 Heisenberg model, Phys. Rev., 164 (1967), 800-817.
R. J. Mathar, Statistics on Small Graphs, arXiv:1709.09000 [math.CO] (2017), Table 57.
Gus Wiseman, Non-isomorphic representatives of the 12 connected graphs counted in row 5.
example: ... (so with 5 edges there's 1 graph with 4 nodes, 5 with 5 nodes and 6 with 6 nodes). [Typo corrected by Anders Haglund, Jul 08 2008]
program: InvEulerMT(u)={my(n=#u, p=log(1+x*Ser(u)), vars=variables(p)); Vec(sum(i=1, n, moebius(i)*substvec(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), vars, apply(v->v^i, vars))/i) )}
edges(v,t) = {prod(i=2, #v, prod(j=1, i-1, my(g=gcd(v[i],v[j])); t(v[i]*v[j]/g)^g )) * prod(i=1, #v, my(c=v[i]); t(c)^((c-1)\2)*if(c%2, 1, t(c/2)))}
T(n)={Mat([Col(p+O(y^n), -n) | p<-InvEulerMT(vector(n, k, G(k, y + O(y^n))))])}
xref: Subsequent diagonals give the number of connected unlabeled graphs with n nodes and n+k edges for k=0..2: A001429, A001435, A001436.
Cf. A002905 (row sums), A001349 (column sums), A008406, A046751 (transpose), A054924 (transpose), A046742 (w/o left column), A343088 (labeled).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
